# Copilot Instructions

This file provides repository-wide instructions for GitHub Copilot.

## General Guidelines

- Follow clean code principles and write maintainable, readable code
- Use meaningful variable and function names
- Include appropriate error handling
- Write code that is consistent with the existing codebase style
- Ensure all code changes are properly tested

## Code Style

- Use consistent indentation and formatting
- Add comments only when necessary to explain complex logic
- Keep functions small and focused on a single responsibility

## Security

- Never commit secrets, API keys, or sensitive credentials
- Validate and sanitize all user inputs
- Follow security best practices for the language and framework in use

## Documentation

- Update documentation when making changes that affect public APIs or user-facing features
- Include clear commit messages that describe the changes made

## Testing

- Write tests for new functionality
- Ensure existing tests pass before submitting changes
- Follow the existing test patterns in the repository
